body: The trouble is that will fail immediately if you have an `import` declaration, since Rollup won't know what the import is relative to. I'm not sure if it's worth adding given that limitation, since the whole point of Rollup is to handle `import` declarations.
It'd be relative to the current directory, likely, that's what I assume browserify does.
This is a possible module to use: https://github.com/sindresorhus/get-stdin

I agree that this feature would be useful. It would particularly enable developers to skip the creation of temporary files in build chains to just do things like `buble index.js | rollup --format cjs` etc.

issue.title: --silent versus --verbose
issue.body:
rollup version 0.47.4

Should stderr info messages be an opt-in with `--verbose` rather than an opt-out with `--silent`?

For quick tests without `--silent` the info messages are a bit distracting:
```
$ bin/rollup test.js -f es

test.js → stdout...
var hello = "Hello";
var world = "Earth";
console.log(`${hello} ${world}`);
created stdout in 32ms
```
They also show up in tests:
```
      no-treeshake

main.js → stdout...
created stdout in 27ms

        ✓ no-treeshake (249ms)
      node-config

main.js → stdout...
created stdout in 8ms

        ✓ node-config (260ms)
      node-config-auto-prefix

main.js → stdout...
created stdout in 8ms

        ✓ node-config-auto-prefix (256ms)
```
Maybe it's my exposure to terse UNIX commands with minimal output. But if the node ecosystem prefers verbose output by default, feel free to close issue.

Hey folks. This is a saved-form message, but rest assured we mean every word. The Rollup team is attempting to clean up the Issues backlog in the hopes that the active and still-needed, still-relevant issues bubble up to the surface. With that, we're closing issues that have been open for an eon or two, and have gone stale like pirate hard-tack without activity.

We really appreciate the folks have taken the time to open and comment on this issue. Please don't confuse this closure with us not caring or dismissing your issue, feature request, discussion, or report. The issue will still be here, just in a closed state. If the issue pertains to a bug, please re-test for the bug on the latest version of Rollup and if present, please tag @shellscape and request a re-open, and we'll be happy to oblige.
